title: Prey (2017)
notes: Runs well on medium settings with only minor stuttering at first. On Higher settings there is much more noticeable stuttering during movement, that does not fade over time, not very playable. No graphical artifacts or bugs encountered.
Works perfectly, 8 hours played so far and no complaints.

notes:
Works fairly well with high graphics. Only issue I have found it that it stutters quite a lot. Although this does seem to reduce a little once it has "warmed up".

Overall though, I'm just glad it even runs and its still very playable!

title: Prey

notes:
Test Configuration:

-Graphic preset: Ultra
-Resolution: 1920x1080
-Fullscreen: Enabled
-Vsync: Off

Problems:
- 2x Slower loading time compared to Windows 10
- 2x Slower texture and shadows loading time compared to Windows 10

Fps:
 ~140Fps in loaded Area
 ~15Fps with a lot of freezing in new Area(due to Texture and Shadows slow loading and rendering)

Input:
- Mouse input lag: none
- Keyboard input lag: none

Sound:
- Razer Kraken Chroma 7.1: equivalent to Windows 10

Resource:
- CPU usage: ~60% (Windows 10: ~80 to 90%)
- Ram usage: ~6Gb (Windows 10: ~7Gb)

title: Prey

notes: Game runs almost perfectly after raising the file descriptor limit in my systemd configuration with DefaultLimitNOFILE=1024:1048576. I have had a couple freezes where I have had to manually kill the process, usually when there's a phantom on screen and I'm attacking it, though that may be a coincidence. Only one crash. Performance degrades when holding turrets. And when using my Steam Controller, the game fails to load the button and action icons for the controller. All dialogs display a rainbow-static icon with the word IMG on top, instead of the proper button icons. All in all though, it's playable besides the occasional freeze once every hour or so.
title: Prey

notes: Runs perfectly but the load times and framerates suffer
